result.execSummary:
The defendant Martel Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Martel Jones
parties.address: PO Box 36, St Croix Correctional Center, New Richmond, WI 54017

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Transfer of probation authorized to Georgia.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply. To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CT, BK, BP, RS, ER, GW or EC. Def shall be within his residence between 10 pm and 6 am unless at or traveling to or from work, school or treatment for the 1st 2 yrs of probation.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

supervisions.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CT, BK, BP, RE, ER, GW or EC.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Referral to Bail Monitoring

CASH BOND AMENDED
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Rashad S., Brittany P., Cordera T., or Brian K.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 7 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
